mapext.emission package

mapext.emission.emission_models module

class mapext.emission.emission_models.ame_lognormal(ame_ampl=10, ame_peak=27, ame_width=0.5, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: FittableEmissionModel

Emission model for an AME lognormal.

Ref:

Stevenson (2014)

Args:

ame_ampl (float): AME peak flux density ame_peak (float): AME peak frequency ame_width (float): AME lognormal width

Either all or none of input nu, area, ame_ampl, ame_peak and ame_width must be provided consistently with compatible units or as unitless numbers.

Model formula:

\[S^\mathrm{AME}_\]

u = A_mathrm{AME} cdot expleft{ - rac{1}{2} left( rac{ln( u/ u_mathrm{AME})}{W_mathrm{AME}} ight)^2 ight}

ame_ampl = Parameter('ame_ampl', value=10.0, bounds=(0, None))
ame_peak = Parameter('ame_peak', value=27.0, bounds=(5, 60))
ame_width = Parameter('ame_width', value=0.5, bounds=(0, 1))
deriv(nu, area, ame_ampl, ame_peak, ame_width)[source]
static evaluate(nu, area, ame_ampl, ame_peak, ame_width)[source]

Evaluate the model on some input variables.

param_names = ('ame_ampl', 'ame_peak', 'ame_width')

Names of the parameters that describe models of this type.

The parameters in this tuple are in the same order they should be passed in when initializing a model of a specific type. Some types of models, such as polynomial models, have a different number of parameters depending on some other property of the model, such as the degree.

When defining a custom model class the value of this attribute is automatically set by the ~astropy.modeling.Parameter attributes defined in the class body.

class mapext.emission.emission_models.freeFree_7000k(ff_em=100, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: FittableEmissionModel

Emission model for free-free emission with an electron temperature of 7000K.

Ref:

Draine (2011)

Args:

ff_em (float): Free-free emission measure

Either all or none of input nu, area and ff_em must be provided consistently with compatible units or as unitless numbers.

Model formula:

\[au^\mathrm{ff}_\]

u = 5.468 imes 10^{-2} cdot T_e^{- rac{3}{2}} left[ rac{ u}{mathrm{GHz}} ight]^{-2} left[ rac{EM}{mathrm{pc,cm}^-6} ight] g^mathrm{ff}_ u

\[g^\mathrm{ff}_\]

u = lnleft(expleft{5.90 - rac{sqrt{3}}{pi}lnleft(left[ rac{ u}{mathrm{GHz}} ight] left[ rac{T_e}{10^4,mathrm{K}} ight] ^ rac{3}{2} ight) ight} + 2.71828 ight)

\[T^\mathrm{ff}_\]

u = T_e left(1-e^{- au^mathrm{ff}_ u} ight)

\[S^\mathrm{ff}_\]

u = rac{2k_BOmega u^2}{c^2} T^mathrm{ff}_ u

deriv(nu, area, ff_em)[source]
static evaluate(nu, area, ff_em)[source]

Evaluate the model on some input variables.

ff_em = Parameter('ff_em', value=100.0, bounds=(0, None))
param_names = ('ff_em',)

Names of the parameters that describe models of this type.

The parameters in this tuple are in the same order they should be passed in when initializing a model of a specific type. Some types of models, such as polynomial models, have a different number of parameters depending on some other property of the model, such as the degree.

When defining a custom model class the value of this attribute is automatically set by the ~astropy.modeling.Parameter attributes defined in the class body.

class mapext.emission.emission_models.synchrotron_1comp(synch_S1=1, synch_alp=-0.7, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: FittableEmissionModel

Emission model for 1-component synchrotron emission without spectral break or curvature (power law).

Ref:

Carol and Ostlie (2007)

Args:

synch_S1 (float): Synchrotron flux at 1GHz synch_alp (float): Synchrotron spectral index

Either all or none of input nu, area, synch_S1 and synch_alp must be provided consistently with compatible units or as unitless numbers.

Model formula:

\[S^\mathrm{\,sync}_\]

u = S1 * u^lpha

deriv(nu, area, synch_S1, synch_alp)[source]
static evaluate(nu, area, synch_S1, synch_alp)[source]

Evaluate the model on some input variables.

param_names = ('synch_S1', 'synch_alp')

Names of the parameters that describe models of this type.

The parameters in this tuple are in the same order they should be passed in when initializing a model of a specific type. Some types of models, such as polynomial models, have a different number of parameters depending on some other property of the model, such as the degree.

When defining a custom model class the value of this attribute is automatically set by the ~astropy.modeling.Parameter attributes defined in the class body.

synch_S1 = Parameter('synch_S1', value=1.0, bounds=(0, None))
synch_alp = Parameter('synch_alp', value=-0.7)
class mapext.emission.emission_models.thermalDust(tdust_Td=20, tdust_tau=-4, tdust_beta=1.5, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: FittableEmissionModel

Emission model for the Planck modified thermal dust curve - a modified blackbody with opacity varying as frequency to some dust spectral index.

Ref:

Draine and Li (2001)

Args:

tdust_Td (float): Thermal dust temperature tdust_tau (float): Thermal dust opacity (given as log_10(tau)) tdust_beta (float): Thermal dust spectral index

Either all or none of input nu, area, tdust_Td, tdust_tau and tdust_beta must be provided consistently with compatible units or as unitless numbers.

Model formula:

\[S^\mathrm{AME}_\]

u = A_mathrm{AME} cdot expleft{ - rac{1}{2} left( rac{ln( u/ u_mathrm{AME})}{W_mathrm{AME}} ight)^2 ight}

deriv(nu, area, tdust_Td, tdust_tau, tdust_beta)[source]
static evaluate(nu, area, tdust_Td, tdust_tau, tdust_beta)[source]

Evaluate the model on some input variables.

param_names = ('tdust_Td', 'tdust_tau', 'tdust_beta')

Names of the parameters that describe models of this type.

The parameters in this tuple are in the same order they should be passed in when initializing a model of a specific type. Some types of models, such as polynomial models, have a different number of parameters depending on some other property of the model, such as the degree.

When defining a custom model class the value of this attribute is automatically set by the ~astropy.modeling.Parameter attributes defined in the class body.

tdust_Td = Parameter('tdust_Td', value=20.0, bounds=(0, None))
tdust_beta = Parameter('tdust_beta', value=1.5)
tdust_tau = Parameter('tdust_tau', value=-4.0)
